cli.content: Show me some markdown examples with **bold** and *italic* text

Here are some **bold** and *italic* text examples:

- **This is bold text**
- *This is italic text*
- ***This is bold and italic***

You can also use `inline code` for technical terms.

# Navigation Guide

## Quick Links

Here are some useful resources:

- [Markdown Guide](https://www.markdownguide.org) - Complete reference
- [GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://github.github.com/gfm/) - Extended syntax
- [CommonMark Spec](https://commonmark.org/) - Standard

> ðŸ’¡ **Tip:** You can use blockquotes like this for highlighting important information.
> Multiple lines can be included in a single blockquote.
> 
> Even code can be included:
> 
> ```thuo
> print("Hello, World!")
> ```


### Horizontal Rules

Use these to separate sections:

---

Another horizontal rule style:

***

And yet another:

___

### Strikethrough Text

~~This is no longer relevant~~ ~~or this~~ ~~or even this~~

### Combined Formatting

You can combine **bold with *italic* nested** and even add `inline code`.

### Emoji Support

While not rendered as actual emojis, you can type: :), :D, :/, >:(

---

## Summary

This demo shows:
- Headers (H1-H3)
- Bold and italic text
- Code blocks with syntax highlighting
- Ordered and unordered lists
- Links and URLs
- Blockquotes
- Horizontal rules
- Strikethrough text
- Combined formatting
- Inline code

All markdown features are properly rendered in the CLI!
